description: The Data Driven Leadership or DDL course is a weeklong, in person, executive education program presented by Carnegie Mellon University's Heinz College of Information Systems, Public Policy and Management. DDL covers the key areas of data management, data science, decision making, emerging technology, change management, data privacy and security - to assist Army leadership in the development of a robust enterprise data management and data science capability to improve decision-making.
**REQUIREMENTS:** The course is designed for GO, SES, O6, CSM or GS15/GS14. All others requesting the course must provide a command memorandum authorizing attendance.

props.headerText: Data Driven Leadership Program FY25 Cohort Dates
content: - Feb. 24-28, 2025 (Acquisition Coded Personnel Only—sign up through AITAS)
- Sept. 8-12, 2025 (Acquisition Coded Personnel Only—sign up through AITAS)
